page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY STROUD
page.content: {EARLY 20TH CENTURY RODBOROUGH:} {Food }Small local shops;goods sold loose by weight;very few tins;fresh fish and bread to the door;milk measured out at the door from churn or copper bucket on milk float.{Traders} Knife sharpener;gipsy clothes pegs; chimney sweep;coal man.{Games }Iron hoop and stick;whip and top;marbles; jacks;swimming races and water polo in canal.{Entertainment}Early cinemas were the Ritz and Spots showing silent films.Piano provided background music. Home entertainment most common with singing and games.Travelling fairs and circuses;Churches walked on Whit holiday and had races and picnics.{ {Schools} Several private schools in large houses.Rodborough school very crowded;teachers very strict;lessons not very interesting.
